column1: EVTDESC666000;Nations which are part of the German Confederation are only influenced by the parliament in Aachen. (Gameplaynote: This event exists to ensure german minors dont get sphered by other GPs);;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC666001;With the recent capture of Bern King Wilhelm of Swabia not only challenged the saxon emporer
column2: but also the Pan-German Parliament. The King of Burgundy demands an intervention and most members of the Parliament seem to agree. The public is outraged and the decision will have consequences either way.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the Parliament stands with Burgundy!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
the Parliament rejects the burgundian demand!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC666005;The Confederation proved to not be able to protect it's members. We dont want to part of this failing state.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC666002;After a heated discussion the Parliament decided to agree to the burgundian pled and now demands that the Emperor intervenes on behalf of Burgundy. ;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTA666002;We stand with the will of the people and the burgundian king!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: we will not attack our brother nation!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC666003;After successfully gaining support from the Parliament the Emperor decided to condem the swabian aggression
column2: demanding the preservation of the status quo.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA666003;Our faith in the confederation is restored!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC666004;After the burgundian king successfully gaining support from the Parliament the Emperor decided to condem the our "aggression"
column2: demanding the preservation of the status quo. ;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA666004;We have dont have a choice
column2: this is a lost cause.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB666004;Pah! Our war is righteous! We are prepared
column2: not even the so called "Emperor" will change the ties - onwards to Lyon!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC666420;The tribes are once again gathering to plunder neighbouring provinces.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT666421OPTA;This will help us to feed the troops.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC666432;Following the Muscovite Revolution the newly formed Triumvirate proclaimed that the Tatar threat will come to an end. Any Tatar aggression would be answered by swift revenge. Our old and fateful ally
column2: the Kazan Khanate now was the first to experience this. Not only was the Khan and it's entire family killed after the capture of the capital
column3: but also were thousends of Muslims massacred. We need to act quick
column4: this new shift in the balance of power could be devastating for us.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVT666432OPTA;Send messengers to the Khans! We need to stand together in times like this!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT666432OPTB;There is no need to act
column2: they are just Russians.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC666433;The Khan of Crimea requests that we should recreate the great Altin Ordu
column2: as it would be the only way to stop russian imperialism.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVT666433OPTA;We will accept the crimean request! The Russians will pay for what they did!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT666433OPTB;Reconsile with Crimea? We are better of alone.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC666437;The Khan of Astrakhan has rejected our humble offer.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT666437OPTA;We will unite the Khanates by all means.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT666437OPTB;The Khan of Astrakhan is fool!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC666436;The Khan of Astrakhan has accepted our proposal!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT666436OPTA;May our united banners strike fear into the Russians once again!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC666439;The Khan of Nogay has rejected our humble offer.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT666439OPTA;We will unite the Khanates by all means.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVT666438OPTA;May our united banners strike fear into the Russians once again!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: hunger and suffering the people of Moscow stormed the Kremlin and captured the Grand Duke. Today three men were elected to lead our nation into a glorious future: The young
column3: but exceptional general Feodor Skobelev
column4: the charismatic Ivan Konstantinov
column5: a diplomat through and through and the adament republican Lev Kuropatkin.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVT676420OPTA;A new age for our nation!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC676420;For centuries the Tatars have raped and pillaged our lands
column2: it is time to bring an end to their aggression. Our leaders have decided to act now and General Skobelev offered to lead the troops personally.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC676422;The kazani threat is finally over
column2: but the government is shocked by Skobelevs brutality and increasing ambition. As the capital Kazan surrenderd he order his men to massacre the cities muslim population and publicly executed the Khan and his family
column3: due to his actions thousands of Kazanis have left the country seeking refugee in Anatolia and Iran. At the same time Skobelev gained the trust of the other military leaders and the former Russian Slaves of Kazan. He even refuses to return to the capital and reports have reached us that he portaits himself as a new monarchy
column4: betraying our revolution. It seems that a coup
column5: or even another civil war will be inevitable.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC9902;Following the musovite conquest of Kazan thousands of Kazani Shiites have fled the country
column2: now seeking refugee in Iran.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
grant them refuge!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC9903;Following the musovite conquest of Kazan thousands of Kazani Shiites have fled the country
column2: now seeking refugee in our nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
grant them refuge!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC666442;In the wake of Skobelevs Rebellion an alliance of Bashkirs and Kazanis have declared their independance. As the rulers of the steppe it is our duty to help our brethern!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC666443;It is time to liberate our Tatar brothers!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC666446;Our diplomats returned with a solid result. The chinese have accepted to concede major parts of Manchuria. Additionally an alliance and a trading agreement were agreed upon.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: we accept the treaty!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVT666446OPTB;This offer is insulting. We demand the entirety of the Amur River Basin
column2: even if that means war!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC9904;The revolting Kazakhs have been defeated and we finally reasserted our control in the Zheytsu region
column2: but following our conquest the Kazakhs left their homes en masse. Their rulers declared a new Khanate in the western kazakh steppe!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC666445;We lost. Our attempt to liberate Kazan ended in a disaster. Not only were our armies crushed
column2: but now the Khans are rejecting our leading role. The future of the Steppe now lies in the hands of the Russians; The age of the Steppelords is over;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVT666445OPTA;There is nothing we can do ...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC666444;Our diplomats returned with a exellent result. The chinese have accepted to concede large parts of Manchuria and much of the Amur Basin. Our new border shall run along the north of the Argun
column2: up to the Nen and all the way down to Korea. Some exeptions were made for the cities of Qiqihar and Jilin
column3: which shall remain within the Shun Empire. Additionally an alliance and a trading agreement were agreed upon.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: we accept this generous treaty!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVT666444OPTB;This offer is insulting. We demand the entirety of the Amur River Basin
column2: even if that means war!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC666447;Our diplomats returned with a nothing but failure. The chinese only accepted to concede minor parts of Manchuria along the Amur River. Even trade agreements were declined!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: but if this prevents war we'll concede.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVT666447OPTB;This offer is more than insulting. We demand the entirety of the Amur River Basin and reperations for such an outrageous act!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC666448;The Russians defeated our armies and reduced our Khanate to a mere rump state. Now even the Yedisan tribes reject the Khans rule and our control over the Circassians has vanished.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT666448OPTA;We are now at the grace of the Russians...;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC676421;The Swedes have taken more direct control in Novgorod. Our population is outraged and even our closest generals and advisors suggest an intervention.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT676421OPTA;We'll put the Swedes in their place!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVT676421OPTB;This is not the right time.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

EVTDESC676423;General Skobelev has built a strong power base in Kazan and in most rural parts of Muscovy. He now demands our resignation and the establishment of a new Monarchy under his rule. While these demands are insulting and outraging
column2: it seems like we dont have another choice if we want to avoid a civil war.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC676425;These fools have rejected our ultimatum. Now that Diplomacy has failed it's time for the Military to act!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC676426;The conquest of Kazan left the former areas of the Khanate in turmoil and devastation. We need to end forgein rule over our people!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC676427;The Tatar Intervention in the civil war turned the tide in favour for the Kazanis.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC676428;The Tatar Intervention in the civil war turned the tide in favour for the Kazanis.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: but the country still remains torn between Republicans and Monarchists. Now it's time to rebuild and strengthen our nation.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVT676429OPTA;May he guide us into a new future!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC676430;We successfully managed to push back the Monarchists. The country
column2: however
column3: is still torn between Republicans and Monarchists
column4: but with Skobelev gone it's time to rebuild and create a proper constitution!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC676424;The construction of this canal will support the econonmic growth of nearby regions!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC410000;The days of Andalusian glory are now but a distant memory. The Algaravian people have been toiling under the Moroccan yoke for centuries
column2: and although the Atlantic ports have grown wealthy
column3: the countryside is destituite and Africans still monopolize the highest spheres of political
column4: economic and social power. Although Morocco has prevented outright contest by the northern Christian nations
column5: it is clear that the Sultanate has entered a steep decline and won't be able to protect us much longer. We
column7: must take destiny into our own hands if we are to survive.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA410000;Al-Andalus shall one day be free.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC410001;The Pashalik Al-Andalus has been a Moroccan dependency for close to five centuries
column2: ever since the intervention of the Sultanate in Iberia stopped the reconquista cold in its tracks. Since then
column3: Al-Andalus has been the economic motor of Morocco and the Algaravian ports have become essential links in trans-Oceanic trade. This wealth is proving
column4: however
column5: to be a poisoned chalice as the nascent burgeois Algaravian class starts to embrace the ideals of nationalism and political societies begin to form

column1: EVTOPTA410001;We can expect trouble in the coming years.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC410002;The relation between Moroccans and Algaravians have grown increasingly strained in the past decades as the economic primacy shifted to the northern shores of the Mediterranean
column2: yet political power remained in the limited circle of the Sultan's court. In a desperate attempt to revitalize the lethargic economy of the Moroccan coast
column3: the government in Fez decreed a set of tariffs to be imposed on the more dynamic Algaravian ports. The decree was the spark needed to ignite the powder keg
column4: and now the Pasha of Al-Andalus has declared independence and proclaimed the rebirth of the Emirate of Granada. The horrors of war will now be unleashed in the fair lands of Andalusia.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTB410002;We will make peace with the Algaravians - they will have to fend for themselves from now on.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC410003;The Pasha of Al-Andalus has been secretly purchasing arms from the northern Christian powers for years
column2: biding his time when an opening might appear to throw off the Moroccan yoke once and for all. With the recent decree from Fez imposing tariffs on Andalusia
column3: completely unacceptable even to the most war-shy of the Algaravian oligarchy
column4: such an opening appeared - and the Pasha
column5: not being a man to let opportunity go
column6: has now declared from the Alhambra the refounding of the Emirate of Granada. Moroccan property is being seized and armies are being marshalled as it becomes clear that Andalusian independence will have to be won on the field of battle.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA410003;Al-Andalus for itself and for Humanity.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC410004;The armies of the Pasha of Al-Andalus have against all odds beaten the Moroccan attempts to stamp out the revolution. With a ruined treasury and brewing trouble in the Sahara
column2: the Sultan of Morocco has accepted to sign a peace treaty recognising the full sovereignity of GharnÃ¡ta over the Andalusian lands.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA410004;There is no victor but God.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC410005;The Revolution in the Pashalik of Al-Andalus has been utterly crushed
column2: the Granadan armies routed and scattered to the countryside. Recognising that his bid for power had failed
column3: the Pasha has surrendered in hopes of attaining some degree of amnesty for himself and the clique that supported him in the insurrection. The government in Fez will be implacable - Andalusia shall never rise again
column4: and the old Pashalik system will be abolished in favour of direct rule.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC410006;The recent events in Andalusia have shown that our traditional enemies
column2: the Algaravians and Moroccans
column3: are weaker and most divided than ever. Opportunity is there to be seized
column4: and the idea of a rebirth of the Reconquista spreads like wildfire through the political classes of the Christian states. A Congress is held in $CAPITAL$ to decide how to best act on the recent developments. A vocal but minoritary lobby argues for unification of the entire Iberian Peninsula under one single
column5: powerful Christian state. Another faction refuses any sort of loss of sovereignity
column6: and insists that Andalusia should be partitioned to avoid bloodshed between Christian brothers. A third group is formed by the military elites of the various states bordering the Algaravian muslims
column7: who argue that only war can decide who deserves to take the spoils of the Moroccan decadence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA410006;Iberia will be united under a single government.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB410006;Andalusia will be partitioned to avoid intra-faith conflict.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTC410006;The gun and the sword will decide
column2: not a group of politicians talking around a table.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTOPTA178900;Make a speech among the crowd.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTOPTB178900;Make a speech from the University balcony.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: who had been invited by the Mamluks after the fall of Baghdad orginally were only puppets of these mamlukian Sultans and mockingly got called "Shadow Caliphs" by other muslim rulers. However the situation has changed
column3: especially within the last century
column4: during the reign of Caliph Al-Hakim III.
column5: who managed to increase the political influence of the Abbasids within the Mamluk Sultanate. Now
column6: even though the Mamluks still hold most of the power
column7: the Abbasids are close to toppling their absolute rule;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC964562;The famous trader and explorer 'Muuzaji Mkubwa'
column2: who helped to cartograph many areas of Tanganyika and beyond recently managed to build and secure a domain of his own in the eastern Kongo. While initially his exipedition was aimed at securing our trading outposts he decided to further increase our influences in the region and established himself as an semi-independent ruler.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC964563;The creation of our Sultanate was mainly to protect swahili trading interests
column2: but since the last year our within the Kongo has massivily increased and our dependence from the Coast has decreased. However
column3: the Bemba from the south are a threat to our rule and clashes in the bordering regions have been frequent. The Sultan at the Coast has rejected our pleed to deal with them
column4: acting against his wishes will most certainly trigger a much larger conflict with the coastal state and even our long time ally and friend Rumaliza doesn't support our plan.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC964565;Even though Muuzaji Mkubwa had the strict order not to act against the Bemba tribes
column2: he now started a full campaign against them. We need to act quick to stop his aggression against our trading partners!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
once a close ally and personal friend to Muuzaji Mkubwa has left the Sultanate and is now heading west
column3: after a heated disscusion about the Bemba War. He demanded that we shouldn't act against the coastal power!;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column3: Queen Dobrovka like her ancestor can bring unity between our two peoples.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC181600;Much like in the days of the old we face a threat to the very independence of italy from verious angles. Only uniting the fractured italian duchys and republics and ensure our survival and perhaps lead us to a new unified Italian State?;x
EVTDESC181601;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has joined the Lombard League and promised to defend italy from foreign invaders.;x

column2: but many people still view as as illegitimate. Perhaps appealing to the pope will give us the legitimacy we despretly need?;x

column1: EVTDESC181603;We have claimed the title of duke of Tuscany
column2: but many people still view as as illegitimate. Perhaps appealing to the pope will give us the legitimacy we despretly need?;x

column2: so as to not couse any distress to their neighbours.;x

column1: EVTDESC181605;We've been granted to crown we despretly needed in a elaborate ceremony organized by the pope!;x
EVTDESC691000;The old Incan state was the the unchallenged superpower of the South American Continent
column2: however with the arrival of the foreigners things changed drastically. Even though earlier contacts were limited to trade and were mostly friendly in nature
column3: the latter arrival of the French in the Northern Andes
column4: followed by their rapid conquest of the Muisca resulted in a direct challenge towards the Incan Authority. This tensions would soon lead to border conflicts and escaltion into the First French-Incan War
column5: which ended in a catastrophic and humiliating defeat for our Empire. However
column6: leasons were learned from this war and a series of reforms were implemented. Furthermore the need to open to country to foreigners came appearent
column7: leading to the establishment of multiple treaties between the Incan State and the Anglo-Norse - archenemy of the French. These reforms resulted in the transformation of the Incan Navy and soon lead to Incan emissaries to China
column9: before the Era of Reform could have been completed
column10: French troops invaded the lands of Kitu and with the inability to halt the invading forces
column11: most of the Incan army was shattered and had to flee into the lands of Tumipampa -  ending the 2nd French-Incan War
column12: this time ending in the lose of core territory. Despite this the people
column13: loyal to the Sapa Inka kept fighting a brutal guerilla war
column14: ultimativly resulting in the French Genocide of Kitu in 1833
column15: transforming a once populous and prosperous region into a wasteland. The current emporer Waskar
column16: humiliated and full of spite is eager for revenge and a second wave of reforms has started and intellectuals
column17: aswell as highly decorated army comanders from China and the North Sea Empire were hired to help to reform the broken administration and army.;x

column2: a state which has been declining for centuries has once again risen from their ashes
column3: with the ascension of Kamran Mirza Shir to the throne in 1767. Already noticed as a smart and witty boy in his childhood
column4: he had proven himself following the Timurid-Sayyid War in 1772
column6: plunder and massacre of Delhi and the incorpartion of Kashmir and Punjab. While to the north the Argyns were defeated and pacified in the Battle of Turkestan in 1776 and in the west the Shiite Beghdilid dynasty was also finally subdued in 1784 and for the first time in centuries the empire once again reached to banks of the Upper Euphrates
column7: while the Beghdilids themselves were reduced to a tributary. Besides his military genius
column8: Shah Kamran Mirza Shir managed to reform large areas of the state and army. Nonetheless
column9: he never was able to establish clear succession rules and with him now beeing an old and senile man
column10: his inability to choose a successor and the increasing power of local rulers and tribes the Timurid Empire is seeming to head once again into chaos.;x

column1: EVTDESC9901;Today the great Kamran Shah passed away in his sleep
column2: without appointing a successor. His oldest son
column3: Amir Qoli Khan
column4: residing in Herat has managed to sway the royal court and officials in Herat and has proclaimed himself to be the new Shah of Iran and Turan. As the news of the death of Kamran Shah are spreading throughout the Empire
column6: the governours of Ajam - Abu Sa'id Mirza
column8: Azerbaijan - Firuz Mirza and Mawarannahr - Salim Babur
column10: have proclaimed themselves as rightful successors. It seems that the Timurid Empire is disintegrating into chaos once again

EVTDESC9905;The sons of Kamran Shah have gone to war with eachother and the Timurid Empire seems to be disintegrating. All the various autonomous Principalities
column2: Chiefdoms
column3: Bekdoms
column4: Emirates have picked a side or managed to break away from the Timurid authority amidst the ensuing chaos. Meanwhile Farhad Khan Zohrabi managed to sway the tribes of Hormuzgan and Laristan and managed to establish a close alliance with Abu Sa'id Mirza.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC9907;As the Empire is errupting into chaos we should choose a side in this conflict;x

EVTDESC9911;The troops of Farhad Khan have managed to gain control over most of the region of Kerman and tribal alligances within the region are shifting. The governour of Kerman was ousted and the Khans of the Baharlu and Afsharids of Kerman
column2: the Arabs of Sirjan and Balochis of the south have sworn their alliagance to him.;x
born into a family of Bazaaris has managed to gather support in the local Zoroastrian community of Yazd. In the wake of the Timurid civil war
column3: the lost of Kerman and a general discontent lead to the support of many peoples within the secluded region of Yazd. Not only has he gained the support of the Gavrunis
column4: but also the desertdwelling Rajis
column6: aswell as Shia Persians have flocked to his banner.;x

column1: EVT9912OPTB;Iran will return to it's antique greatness under Zoroastrian rule

column2: a Sufi order preaching a radical form of Islam
column3: have been discrimnated and suppresed since the rule of Fathullah Shah in the mid 18th century. Still
column4: they managed to build a powerbase within the remote and mountainous regions of Hazaristan.;x

column1: EVT9913OPTB;The Time of Martyrdom has come
column2: say the Takbir! §R(Continue as the Tawaniyya)§W;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: a minor tribe of the greater Karlani confederation
column3: has managed to storm the great city of Kabul
column4: gem of the Hindukush. News of their success have spread quick and many of the Pashtun tribes have joined their rebellion!;x

column1: EVT9914OPTB;Down with the Timurids! §R(Continue as the Zorakis)§W;;;;;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC9915;As the collapse of our authority becomes more and more appereant
column2: the govenours of Balkh and Khiva
column3: once staunch supporters to our claim to the throne have now turned against us!;x

column1: EVTDESC9916;The Yomuds had been a de jure vassal of ours for decades
column2: however hour actual control over them was always very nominal. With the erruption of the Succession War they used the chance to completely break away from our authority and managed to rally multiple other Turkmen tribes around them - most notably the Teke Turkmens of the Kapet Dagh. Together they managed to storm our fort in Akhal and launched an attack on the oasis of Merv
column3: only to be repelled by the Afsharid governours;x

column1: EVTNAME9917;Unrest in the Streets of Herat;x
EVTDESC9917;The Succesion War has driven Iranian society into total anarchy. The country is ravaged by war and thousands of people have fleed their homes. However Herat
column2: up until now never was under a real threat
column3: but presure on the city started to increase with the Yomud Invasion. Since than the multiple Khans
column4: Amirs and Chieftains of Khorasan had to really on themselves and their tribes to protect themselves against the Zohrabi attacks
column6: Tawaniyya extremists and constant other outside threats. Furthermore the increasing amount of refugees out and inside the city brought terrible stories with them
column7: all the while the students of the Herat university have built an underground network
column8: with the goal of establishing a western-styled

column1: EVTDESC9919;As control over Khorasan deminished and unrest in the capital rapidly increased
column2: the uninventable happened. Today an union of students
column3: professors and others - inspired by the events of the German Revolutions in the 20s - stormed the Citadel of Herat and killed Amir Qoli Khan in the process
column4: proclaiming the independent government of Herat.;x

column2: Khozeimeh
column3: Mogholistan
column4: Jalayerids or Qara'i;x

column1: EVTDESC606001;Lozania has always been a brutish
column2: violent place. It was first established in the 16th century by Saxon conquerors who subjugated and enslaved much of the native population. The soldiers were followed soon after by convicts
column3: sent to serve out their sentences on the far side of the world. The Saxons established great plantation farms called "Landjots
column4: and put natives and convicts alike to forced work. Lorded over by the Landhär
column5: the landed aristocracy and ruling class of the colony, the landjots replicated the social relations of European serfdom in the new world. In time a multiethnic class of Kneiht" developed
column6: peons bonded to the landjots where they were born and forced to till the soil their whole lives. Since the early days of Lozania the kneiht have formed the overwhelming majority of the population
column7: living in constant fear of the violence and oppression of the landhär.;x

column1: EVTDESC606002;When the German Revolution engulfed Europe
column2: Saxony's prized Lozanian colonies were left adrift. With the Saxon Kingdom tied up in its fight with the revolutionaries and their opportunistic Nordic allies
column3: the Lozanians were cut from contact with Europe and forced to fend for itself against no less than three Vinlandic invasions. The landhär had no other choice but to adopt greater self-government in order to defend themselves
column4: at least until contact could be reestablished with Saxony. Across Lozania
column5: councils of landhär took power and organised to fight off the Northmen. Meanwhile the mass of Lozanian kneiht had begun to stir
column6: inspired by events in Europe. Long oppressed by the landhär
column7: the kneiht demanded an end to their bondage and land of their own to farm. A handful of forward thinking landhär
column8: led by the charismatic Edwin Hoeber
column9: promised them freedom in exchange for service in his army.;x

column1: EVTDESC606003;His ranks swelled by tens of thousands of kneiht
column2: Edwin Hoeber led the colonies to a series of smashing victories against Vinland. When the revolution ended
column3: Hoeber and his allies expected to be richly rewarded by the Saxon crown
column4: but instead found that the triumphant reactionary government in Dortmund was calling for their heads. The Saxon revanchists were not happy with Lozanian concessions to the kneiht
column5: or with colonial autonomy. War soon followed
column6: waged between patriotic forces led by Hoeber and Saxon loyalists backed by the father country. In 1821
column7: Saxony was forced to formally recognise the independence of the Republic of Lozania. Since that day the progressive landhär have followed through with many of their promises
column8: abolishing peonage in law and parcelling out the properties of traitor landhär. Yet today much remains unchanged in Lozania. Peonage still exists in practice in large parts of the country
column9: and politics is still dominated by the landhär.;x

column1: EVTDESC606004;Now that the territories of the Tuscarora and Nanticoke tribes are in our hands
column2: the question has arisen of what to do with the natives themselves. While their former lands are occupied by our military
column3: the tribespeople are still living there. Many conservative landhär and even some progressive landhär have come out in support of a proposal to forcibly evict the Tuscarora and Nanitoke
column4: marching them west at gunpoint to live in the territory of the Lenape. Many believe that either of the newly acquired territories would be a perfect site for a new
column6: an idea that has been much discussed since independence. Opponents of the proposal
column7: mostly amongst the most progressive of the landhär
column8: argue that Tuscarora and Nanticoke will suffer greatly on the march west
column9: and their expulsion into Lenape land will needlessly antagonise the western tribes.;x

column1: EVTDESC606005;The tribes of the west have not taken kindly to the cession of Tuscarora and Nanticoke lands. The tribal chiefs view Lozania's betrayal of its native allies as a sign that any deal signed with the landhÃ¤r is not worth the paper it was written on
column2: and the belief that Lozania has ambitions of western conquest and colonisation is now widespread. Already border skirmishes between Lenape natives and HonsrÃ¶ggen settlers have already begun to take place along the length of the western frontier. A Shawnee chief by the name of Naythawaynah has begun to exploit the furore
column3: travelling from settlement to settlement trying to enlist the disparate tribes in a confederacy to resist the Lozanians. So far he has had only limited success
column4: but with growing anger at our actions it may only be a matter of time before Naythawaynah gets what he wants. War may very well prove inevitable.;x
